product_overview: Evolution Go API is a high-performance, lightweight WhatsApp API implementation built in Go. It provides a robust and efficient RESTful API for WhatsApp integration using the whatsmeow library, supporting real-time events, media handling, and scalable deployments with optional PostgreSQL storage and Docker support.
core_goals: Deliver a fast and scalable WhatsApp API solution with minimal dependencies.
Provide comprehensive WhatsApp Web multidevice protocol support via the whatsmeow library.
Enable real-time messaging and event handling through WebSocket and webhook integrations.
Offer persistent message storage with optional PostgreSQL integration.
Support rich media messages including images, videos, audio, and documents.
Ensure secure API access with authentication and middleware support.
Facilitate easy deployment through Docker and provide comprehensive developer documentation.
key_features: RESTful API with clean, well-documented endpoints covering instance management, messaging, and status checking.
Real-time event support through WebSocket and webhook mechanisms.
Complete media support for sending and receiving images, videos, audio, and documents.
QR code generation for WhatsApp device pairing.
Optional PostgreSQL database integration for persistent message storage.
Docker-ready with preconfigured container images and support for Docker Compose.
Comprehensive logging and configurable log levels for debugging and monitoring.
Middleware support for authentication, validation, and custom logic.
Auto-generated Swagger/OpenAPI documentation accessible via API endpoint.
Support for AMQP/RabbitMQ for advanced messaging workflows.
user_flow_summary: Developers register and create WhatsApp instances via the API.
Users scan generated QR codes to pair WhatsApp instances using the API endpoint.
Applications send text or media messages through the API to WhatsApp contacts.
Real-time events such as incoming messages or status updates are forwarded via WebSocket or webhook URLs.
Administrators set up optional PostgreSQL storage for message persistence.
Developers deploy the API using Docker for easy environment management and scalability.
Developers access Swagger documentation to explore and test API capabilities during development.
validation_criteria: API endpoints provide expected responses according to Swagger documentation.
QR code generation triggers correctly and is scannable for pairing devices.
Real-time event delivery via WebSocket or webhook functions without delay or data loss.
Message storage optional feature reliably saves and retrieves messages from PostgreSQL.
Media messages transmit and receive correctly across supported formats.
Authentication and middleware enforce access controls strictly across all endpoints.
Docker images build and run smoothly in both development and production modes.
Automated tests cover functionality with passing results and maintain a minimum code coverage threshold.
Logging captures detailed info and errors consistent with configured log levels.
